锿（台湾、香港、澳门称鑀，旧译作䥺）（Einsteinium）是一种人工合成元素，符号为Es，原子序为99。锿是第7个超铀元素，属于锕系元素。1952年12月由加州大学伯克利分校物理学家吉奥索等人首次发现[1-3]。
锿是在1952年第一次氢弹爆炸的残余物中发现的，并以物理学家阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦命名。其最常见的同位素为锿-253（半衰期为20.47天），是通过锎-253的衰变而人工制造的，每年在高能核反应炉中的产量约为1毫克。合成之后，锿-253要从其他锕系元素及其衰变产物中分离出来，这是个复杂的过程。其他的锿同位素则在各个实验室中以较轻元素的离子撞击锕系元素而合成，但产量少得多。锿除了用于合成新的元素，主要用于发射X射线。锿曾在1955年用于首次合成钔元素，并一共合成了17颗钔原子。
锿是一种柔软的银白色金属，具顺磁性。其化学属性符合典型的重锕系元素，容易形成+3氧化态，并特别在固体中也可以形成+2态。锿-253的高放射性会使它明显地发光，并会迅速破坏其晶体金属结构，每克释放大约1000瓦的热量。由于锿-253每天都损失3%的质量，并依次衰变为锫和锎，因此对锿的研究十分困难。锿-252是存留时间最长的锿同位素（半衰期为471.7天），可以用于研究锿的物理特性，但生产锿-252是极为困难的，每次的产量也极少。锿是最后一种曾在宏观尺度下以纯元素形态被研究过的元素，所用的同位素是常见但半衰期短的锿-253。和其他的人工合成超铀元素一样，锿是极具放射性的，如果进食了会对健康造成损害。
Einsteinium (called 鑀 in Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Macau, formerly translated as 䥺) (Einsteinium) is an artificially synthesized element with a symbol of Es and an atomic number of 99. Einsteinium is the seventh transuranium element and belongs to the actinide series . It was first discovered in December 1952 by Gioso , a physicist at the University of California, Berkeley [1-3] .
Einstein was discovered in the remnants of the first hydrogen bomb explosion in 1952 and was named after the physicist Albert Einstein. Its most common isotope is Einsteinium-253 ( half-life of 20.47 days), which is artificially manufactured through the decay of californium-253, and the annual output in high-energy nuclear reactors is about 1 mg. After synthesis, Einsteinium-253 must be separated from other actinides and their decay products, which is a complicated process. Other einsteinium isotopes are synthesized in various laboratories with lighter element ions colliding with actinide elements, but the yield is much lower. In addition to being used to synthesize new elements, einsteinium is mainly used to emit X-rays. Einstein was used to synthesize the element of curium for the first time in 1955, and a total of 17 curium atoms were synthesized.
Einsteinium is a soft silver-white metal with paramagnetic properties. Its chemical properties are in line with the typical heavy actinides, which are easy to form +3 oxidation state, and can also form +2 state especially in solids. The high radioactivity of Einsteinium-253 will make it emit light obviously, and will quickly destroy its crystal metal structure, releasing about 1000 watts of heat per gram. Because Einium-253 loses 3% of its mass every day and decays into berkelium and california in turn, it is very difficult to study Einium. Eininium-252 is the longest-lived einsteinium isotope (half-life of 471.7 days). It can be used to study the physical properties of Eininium, but it is extremely difficult to produce Eininium-252, and the yield per time is very small. Einsteinium is the last element that has been studied in the form of pure elements on a macro scale. The isotope used is Eininium-253, which is common but has a short half-life. Like other synthetic transuranic elements, einsteinium is extremely radioactive and can cause health damage if eaten.
